ygData.subject: RE: Necro balancing
ygData.msgSnippet: ... character is a druid (I deliberately did not choose bard because my friend, Windsong, was a bard and I _always_ fail when it comes down to competitions
ygData.messageBody:
> This isn't an attack against younger people, however look at the
> average age of druids/necros. Druids/Necros are two of the most
> powerful solo'ing classes in the game (the powerleveler's dream
> if you will). It's only fitting that those immature very young
> powergaming types, a stereotype of both classes mind you, would
> whine much like a child who just had his lollipop taken from him.

:( The druid community has changed, at some point. My original
character is a druid (I deliberately did not choose bard because
my friend, Windsong, was a bard and I _always_ fail when it comes
down to competitions between the two of us so I have learned just
not to compete.) And I can remember a time when I was proud to be
a druid. We were helpful, and generally considered a good group to
run across on the servers. The Druid's Grove rarely had a complainer
in it and, rather, was people helping each other.

Now, everything as turned backwards. I've even heard that druids aren't
welcome in groups because the general idea is that they have solo'd their
way through the levels, etc. (That doesn't effect me. I only play
my druid when my friend is around and I always play with her same-
level monk. Then we see what else we can gather. But a lot of time
its just the two of us.)

It makes me quite sad to see how they have changed. I certainly have not
changed.

Sarah Heacock sarah@...
Meara, level 13 Enchanter, Master Jeweler, owner Meara's Boutique of
Mystiques, Phoenix, Solusek Ro /
Faerain, level 18 Soldier of Tunare, Phoenix, Solusek Ro /
Faesong, level 7 HalfElf Bard of Solusek Ro, Solusek Ro (Qeynos Hills)
